definition: Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), grandson of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗, first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
to neglect/to overlook/to ignore/suddenly
surname Hu
certainly/must/will/necessarily
ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements

sentences.english: The kingdom was conquered by the Mongol and Chinese armies of Kublai Khan.
sentences.chinese: 大理王国后来被忽必烈率领的蒙汉联军击败。

sentences.english: The kingdom was conquered by the Mongol and Chinese armies of Kublai Khan .
sentences.chinese: 大理王国后来被忽必烈率领的蒙古族和汉族军队攻破。

sentences.english: Kublai's kingdom was not only about the Silk Road over land.
sentences.chinese: 忽必烈时代不仅仅是只有“丝绸之路”。

sentences.english: The year 1274 saw Mongol ruler Kublai Khan's first invasion of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 在一二七四年，蒙古统治者忽必烈汗第一次进侵日本。

sentences.english: At Peking was the Great Khan, and they were hospitably entertained.
sentences.chinese: 忽必烈汗在北京，他们受到了盛情款待。

sentences.english: The times of Kublai Khan was the mature and flourishing period of Kublai Khan Yuan Zaju.
sentences.chinese: 忽必烈时代是元杂剧成熟并繁盛的时期。

sentences.english: At that time, China was RULED BY THE Yuan Dynasty Emperor, Kublai Khan.
sentences.chinese: 当时元世祖忽必烈汗正统治着中国。

sentences.english: Khubilai Khan established the Yuan dynasty in Central Plains.
sentences.chinese: 至忽必烈在中原大地建立了蒙元王朝。

sentences.english: Yuan of the Mongols. Genghis Khan and Kublai Khan.
sentences.chinese: 当时元世祖忽必烈汗正统治着中国。

sentences.english: He confuses the two, mixing up details about the first expedition with those of the second.
sentences.chinese: 他将忽必烈第一次和第二次远征的细节弄混了。

sentences.english: From the times of Kublai Khan, Peking was known to the West.
sentences.chinese: 自忽必烈大汗之时起，北京便声蜚于西方。

sentences.english: Marco Polo 's travelogue mentions that Kublai Khan sent envoys to Malgache .
sentences.chinese: 马可波罗游记中提到忽必烈曾派使节到过马尔加什。

sentences.english: The famed Kublai khan ruled his empire from a palace here.
sentences.chinese: 著名的忽必烈可汗就是在这建立他的王朝。

sentences.english: After years of war, Kublai Khan's armies conquered the Song Dynasty in 1279.
sentences.chinese: 经过几年的战争，忽必烈汗于1279年灭亡了宋朝。

sentences.english: Hu-Bilie and Confucian scholars' relationship can be divided by two periods.
sentences.chinese: 忽必烈与儒士的关系，可以明显地分为两个阶段。

definition: Bayan (name)/Bayan of the Baarin (1236-1295), Mongol Yuan general under Khubilai Khan, victorious over the Southern Song 1235-1239/Bayan of the Merkid (-1340), Yuan dynasty general and politician
Ögedei Khan (1186-1242), a son of Genghis Khan
Yollig Taxin or Yelü Dashi (1087-1143), Chinese-educated Khitan leader, founder of Western Liao 西遼|西辽 in Central Asia

Yelü Chucai (1190-1244), Khitan statesman and advisor to Genghis Khan and Ögödei Khan, known for convincing the Mongols to tax the conquered population of the north China plains rather than slaughter it
Ögedei Khan (1186-1242), a son of Genghis Khan
Tolui (1193-1232), fourth son of Genghis Khan
Mongol

Hong Taiji (1592-1643), eighth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, reigned 1626-1636 as Second Khan of Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金, then founded the Qing dynasty 大清 and reigned 1636-1643 as Emperor/posthumous name 清太宗
Mongolia
Dorgon (1612-1651), fourteenth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, successful general, instrumental in Manchu conquest of China, ruled China as regent 1644-1650 for his nephew Emperor Shunzhi 順治帝
Temujin, birth name of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗[Cheng2 ji2 si1 han2]
Muqali or Mukhali (1170-1223), military commander under Genghis Khan 成吉思汗[Cheng2 ji2 si1 han2]
Li Yuanhao (1003-1048), founding king of Xixia 西夏[Xi1 Xia4] around modern Ningxia 寧夏|宁夏[Ning2 xia4]
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Jin Dynasty (1115-1234), founded by the Jurchen 女真[Nu:3 zhen1] people of North China, a precursor of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty
Timur or Tamerlane (1336-1405), Mongol emperor and conqueror
